content:
• Friday, June 22, 2018
  • OBLN

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (06/22/2018)

    • Top gainers: OBLN +4.1%. QURE +3.3%. PER +2.0%. GHG +1.9%. GEN +1.8%.
    • Top Losers: RENN -5.5%. CDNA -3.6%.  EOLS -3.0%. MRNS -2.9%. CBMG -2.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • XSPA

    XpresSpa CFO, legal chief exit company

    • XpresSpa (NASDAQ:XSPA) is shifting executives after two departures.
    • Chief Financial Officer Anastasia Nyrkovskaya has resigned to pursue other opportunities; over the next four months, she'll work with XpresSpa to ensure a smooth transition.
    • Controller Janine Canale is taking on the additional post of principal accounting officer.
    • The company also said Jason Charkow, its senior VP of legal and business affairs, left the company effective May 23, 2018, and named Jonathan Kraft its general counsel.
    • Shares declined 4.7% today.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 26 Comments
  • ACIA

    Reuters: ZTE will make escrow deposit soon to lift ban

    • ZTE is expected to deposit $400M in a U.S. bank escrow account within the next couple of days, according to a Reuters source.
    • The escrow deposit is the last step before the government will lift the ban on ZTE receiving goods from U.S. suppliers. 
    • ZTE supplier Acacia Communications (NASDAQ:ACIA) is up 0.4% aftermarket.
    • NXP Semiconductors (NASDAQ:NXPI) closed today up 2% but has dropped 0.8% aftermarket. The thawing relations between the countries could make China more likely to approve NXP’s acquisition by Qualcomm.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 42 Comments
  • DRGDF

    Detour Gold +5% as shareholder Paulson urges sale

    • Detour Gold (OTCPK:DRGDF +4.7%) is sharply higher as hedge fund manager John Paulson urges company to explore strategic alternatives including a possible sale, citing stock losses amid managerial missteps.
    • Paulson, who owns a 5.4% stack in the Canadian miner, says Detour's directors had “failed to recruit and oversee a management team capable of operating the Detour Lake mine in a manner that delivers returns to shareholders," according to a copy obtained by Bloomberg.
    • Paulson's sentiments are shared by other shareholders, including Franklin Templeton, Mackenzie Investments, Tocqueville Asset Management and VanEck.
    • In April, Detour lowered production guidance, raised its cost guidance and said it was reassessing a mine plan; the updated plan is scheduled for release on June 27.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 7 Comments
  • OPHC

    OptimumBank +7.8% as affiliate purchases outstanding trust preferred

    • OptimumBank (OPHC +7.8%) reports a company controlled by Moishe Gubin, a director of OPHC, completed the purchase of all the outstanding trust preferred securities issued by OPHC.
    • OPHC says it's had talks with the purchaser on how to handle the existing default with respect to the trust preferred securities, including the possible issuance of common stock in exchange for some of the securities.
    • No definitive agreement between OPHC and the purchase have been reached, and there's no assurance that the talks will result in any agreement, the company says.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • ABBV

    AbbVie's Humira could face pressure from biosimilars, analyst says

    • AbbVie (ABBV -1.6%) tumbles to a two-month low after Credit Suisse said the company's blockbuster arthritis treatment Humira could face increasing sales pressure from rival copycat drugs later this year.
    • Analyst Vamil Divan says patents protect Humira sales in the U.S. until 2023, but he expects to see biosimilar competition in Europe later this year.
    • "With our estimates suggesting the biologic blockbuster Humira accounts for 60% of AbbVie's total (net present value), we remain cautious on AbbVie's outlook in front of Humira biosimilar competition," Divan writes.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 99 Comments
  • LNG

    Cheniere Energy reiterated a Buy at Stifel on CPC gas deal

    • Cheniere Energy (LNG +4.6%) is reiterated with a Buy rating at Stifel with an $80 price target, raised from $75, after CPC Corp. of Taiwan announced a Heads of Agreement to buy 2M metric tons/year of liquefied natural gas for 25 years.
    • While HOA is not a binding agreement and Cheniere has not made a formal announcement about the deal, it is as close to a done deal as possible without actually being a done deal, says Stifel analyst Benjamin Nolan.
    • "This plays directly into our thesis that there will be a rapid development of U.S. LNG exports and that Cheniere is best positioned as the winner in such an environment," Nolan writes.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 63 Comments
  • ABIL

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 PM (06/22/2018)

    • Gainers: ABIL +12%. PKE +16%. MTSL +10%. IMOS +7%. AMSWA +6%.
    • Losers: OTCPK:LFIN -27%. SGLB -12%. RHT -12%. SGH -10%. I -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • TSLA

    Tesla -3% as analyst questions company data on rise in services costs

    • Tesla (TSLA -3.1%) tumbles after Bernstein analyst Toni Sacconaghi raises concerns about how the company may be allocating its expenses across different businesses.
    • Sacconaghi wonders how TSLA's gross profit margin for its Services and Other segment declined to -45% in Q1 2018 from +5% in its Q3 2016 report when the company's data points to a buildout in services infrastructure for the cost increase without a commensurate sales climb.
    • He poses three possibilities: "(1) some portion of warranty expenses are being accrued in 'Services and Other', though we note that TSLA's overall warranty accruals appear generous vs. other manufacturers, and the company states that it includes all warranty expense in its Automotive segment; (2) post warranty work is high and being done for free, resulting in limited Services revenues but escalating COGS; or (3) there is some other incremental service cost associated with Model 3 (given that Service revenues and COGs appeared to diverge at the time of Model 3 ramp)."
    • Sacconaghi reaffirms his Market Perform rating and $265 price target on the shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 235 Comments
  • CS

    Non-U.S. multinational banks perk up as eurozone economy revives

    • Many non-U.S.-based multinational banks gain by more than 1% today as a better-than-expected economic report reflects a resurgence of eurozone business activity and a debt-relief deal for Greece is reached.
    • Two Swiss banks lead the pack, Credit Suisse (CS +3.1%) and  (UBS +2.9%). Others with strong showings today--Barclays (BCS +1.7%), Deutsche Bank (DB +1.5%), RBS (RBS +1.5%), ING Groep (ING +1.4%), Banco Santander (SAN +0.8%), Lloyds Banking Group (LYG +1.1%), HSBC Holdings (HSBC +1.2%).
    • Depressed by the Argentine economic woes for much of  2018, BBVA (BBVA +1.7%) is up nicely today. However, since reaching a 52-week high of $9.54.on Jan. 26,  BBVA has lost about 25%, now trading at about $7..
    • In India: ICICI Bank(IBN +1.5%), HDFC Bank (HDB +1.6%) are on the rise.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 41 Comments
  • TAP

    Molson Coors in talks with marijuana companies - Bloomberg

    • With pot legalization looming in Canada, and aiming for growth as beer sales decline, Molson Coors (TAP +1.9%) has been in talks with up to four Canadian cannabis companies, according to Bloomberg. The discussions, says the report, are "serious," with a deal maybe announced by year-end.
    • Among the companies with which TAP has talked with are Aphria (APHQF -4.4%) and Aurora Cannabis (ACBFF -3.4%).
    • Molson Coors wouldn't be the first alcohol-related company to enter the marijuana space, but - with a market cap near $15B - it would be the largest. Constellation Brands (STZ +0.2%) last year, purchased a 9.9% stake in Canopy Growth (CGC -6.7%) for $245M.
    • Selected pot tickers: OTC:HMLSF, OTC:CMMDF, OTCPK:MJNA, CGC, APHQF, CRON, MJ, ACBFF, OTCQB:AERO, OTCPK:AMMJ, OTCPK:BLOZF, OTCQX:CANN, OTCQB:CBDS, OTCPK:CBIS, OTCQB:CVSI, OTCPK:ERBB, OTCPK:FBEC, OTCQB:GBLX, OTCPK:GRSU, OTCPK:HEMP, OTCPK:MYDX, OTCPK:GRNH, GWPH, OTCQB:KSHB, OTCQB:MSRT, OTCQX:OGRMF, OTCQB:PHOT, OTCQB:PMCB, OTCPK:PNTV, OTCQB:RMHB, OTCQB:SGBY, OTCQX:SPRWF, OTCQB:SRNA, OTCQX:THCBF, OTCQX:TRTC, OTCPK:UBQU, HYYDF, OTCQB:RSSFF, OTCPK:AGTK, OTCPK:MJNE, OTCPK:CBCA, OTCPK:CBYI, OTCPK:EAPH, OTCPK:MJMJ, OTCQX:SPRWF, OTCPK:REFG, OTCQX:ZDPY, TLRY
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 245 Comments
  • HOG

    Harley-Davidson says EU tariffs likely to cause price hikes this fall

    • Harley-Davidson (HOG -2.6%) likely will need to raise prices in Europe this fall as new motorcycle models hit dealer showrooms, thanks to European Union tariffs on U.S. goods, the head of its central European business tells Reuters.
    • The European Commission said earlier this week that it would start charging 25% duties on a range of U.S. imports in retaliation for U.S. tariffs on EU steel and aluminum.
    • HOG says it is getting hit by tariffs twice - once by the EU import duty and once by a rise in raw material prices resulting from U.S. steel tariffs.
    • HOG has been aiming to increase sales of its motorcycles overseas to 50% of total annual volume from ~43% currently amid a slump in U.S. demand.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 13 Comments
  • CRC

    Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (06/22/2018)

    • Gainers: CRC +16%. EPE +14%. DNR +12%. MBII +12%. NE +11%.
    • Losers: SNES -6%. PLM -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 9 Comments
  • RHHBY

    Roche sues Amgen over Herceptin biosimilar

    • According to the suit filed by Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY +2.4%) Genentech unit, Amgen's (AMGN -0.2%) proposed biosimilar of the Herceptin breast cancer drug would infringe on 37 patents.
    • Herceptin accounted for about 5% of Roche's revenue last year, according to Bloomberg. Amgen earlier this year told Genentech it's not planning on marketing its version - ABP 980 - until October 28 at the earliest.
    • Previously: Amgen's biosimilar for Herceptin fails to win FDA approval (June 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 4 Comments
  • IHRTQ

    Liberty Media pulls offer for 40% iHeartMedia stake

    • Liberty Media (FWONA +3.8%) has withdrawn its proposal from earlier this year to buy 40% of now-bankrupt iHeartMedia (OTCPK:IHRTQ) for $1.16B.
    • At the time Liberty was willing to finance working capital through DIP financing along with a Chapter 11 filing.
    • Liberty's pulled its proposal "after reviewing results which were below expectations and negatively impacted our initial estimates of value," the company's statement says. "We remain open to future discussions as iHeart proceeds with its reorganization."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM | 5 Comments
  • NTRA

    Natera up 10% on kidney transplant news; CareDx plunges

    • Natera's (NTRA +10.7%) dd-cfDNA assay demonstrated 92% sensitivity in detecting acute rejection, identifying 48 out of 52 affected cases based on a cutoff of 1% dd-cfDNA. Thats versus the competition at just 59% in a 2017 study, says the company.
    • Natera plans to begin selling the assay in 2019.
    • The competition: CareDx (CDNA -17.2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • PCG

    PG&E up nearly 5% on session

    • Investors continue to react positively to yesterday's news that the company isn't planning a capital raise to cover the $2.5B charge from last year's NoCal wildfires.
    • In the meantime, the utility is lobbying California lawmakers to overturn a law restricting the ability to raise rates to cover wildfire liability costs.
    • Bloomberg takes note of spiking call option volume today, with 3.6K of the July $43 strikes purchased vs. previous open interest of just about 1K. There's also sizable buying action in the July $49 and July $48 strikes.
    • PCG +4.5%
     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 5 Comments
  • IGC

    More on India Globalization Capital's FY results

    • India Globalization Capital (OTC:IGC +2%) reported FY revenue of $2.19M (+277.6% Y/Y), the revenue was generated from legacy business that includes trading of steel and iron ore and rental of heavy equipment.
    • FY gross margin declined by 3,388 bps to 3.72% and operating recovered by 27,239 bps to -81.6%.
    • SG&A expenses decreased by 17.7% Y/Y to $1.87M.
    • Company expects to add revenue from Hyalolex in the second half of 2018, with a goal of introducing the product into 10 states by the end of 2018 and maintain annual trading revenue of $3-5M from legacy business.
    • Cash and cash equivalents of $1.65M as of March 31, 2018.
    • Company developed a QR code-based system for patients to access a specific website with information on Hyalolex, and also are in the process of creating a mobile optimized version. With increasing availability of the product in different states, company plans to expand the back-end to a blockchain allowing direct inputs from growers, processors and dispensaries.
    • Previously: India Globalization Capital reports FY results (June 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • CURO

    Financials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (06/22/2018)

    • Gainers: CURO +6%. CIFS +6%.
    • Losers: GRBK -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • TROX

    Reuters: EU regulators set to approve Tronox's Cristal deal with conditions

    • Tronox (TROX +3.4%) deal to acquire Cristal’s titanium dioxide business is set to be approved by the European Union on the condition that TROX sells assets to address competition concerns, Reuters reports.
    • TROX offered concessions last month without providing details after the European Commission stated concerns about the deal in March.
    • TROX and Cristal are two of the world's three top suppliers of chloride process titanium dioxide used to make paint, plastic, paper and other products.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • SLNO

    Midday Gainers / Losers (06/22/2018)

    • Gainers: SLNO +27%. YECO-OLD +24%. CADC +23%. WSC +19%. INFI +18%. CRC +15%. MXC +14%. DNR +13%. MTSL +13%. PKE +13%.
    • Losers: OTCPK:LFIN -28%. NAKD -23%. XBIO -21%. CDNA -17%. OBLN -16%. SGLB -15%. GEMP -15%. DCPH -14%. RGSE -13%. PTIE -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • MBT

    MBT -2.2% as lawmakers urge sanctioning Russian tycoon

    • Top Russian wireless firm Mobile TeleSystems (NYSE:MBT) is off 2.2% in NYSE trading after two U.S. representatives have urged sanctions against Russian billionaire Vladimir Yevtushenkov.
    • "We urge the Department of the Treasury and the Department of State ... to promptly investigate Vladimir Yevtushenkov, AFK Sistema holding company, and Mobile TeleSystems, and if merited, to sanction them as authorized," reads a letter sent last month from Reps. Ileana Ros-Lehtinen and Mark Walker.
    • The lawmakers also refer to the corruption probe that the U.S. and others launched due to wireless activities in Uzbekistan, an investigation that also swept up Veon (VEON +1.1%), then VimpelCom.
    • Peers: PJSC Rostelecom (OTCQX:ROSYY) is up 2.7% in OTC trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM | 10 Comments
  • MCHP

    Microchip -2.2% on joining Hedgeye Best Idea Short list

    • Hedgeye analyst Ami Joseph adds Microchip Technology (NASDAQ:MCHP) to the Best Idea Short list and sees a 25% downside due to the risk of the Microsemi acquisition.
    • Managed realized during the discovery process that Microsemi’s margins weren’t as high as what was disclosed. 
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word. 
    • Microchip share are down 2.2% to $96.52.   
     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • XAUMF

    Goldmoney up 5.3% post FY results

    • Goldmoney (OTCPK:XAUMF +5.3%) reports FY revenue growth of 9.3% Y/Y to C$572.4M.
    • For Q4, Precious Metal revenue of C$140.5M (+10.2% Q/Q), highlighting strong organic growth and consistent outperformance versus industry peers in precious metals dealing.
    • Also, Cryptocurrency revenue for Q4 was C$30.6M, an increase of 36.6% Q/Q for an organic business built and deployed internally.
    • Fully-Reserved Precious Metal Loan Portfolio of C$19.5M (+126.7% Y/Y).
    • Cash and Tangible Capital increased 90% Y/Y to C$111.5M.
    • 68% Per-Share Y/Y growth in gold-denominated Tangible Capital per share, highlighting management’s focus on a positive Return on Metal Weight on an annual basis.
    • “Looking ahead to Fiscal 2019, we hope to deliver another year of strong per-share ROMW gains as we deliver on our group’s investments in Men and its spinout on the TSX Venture and BlockVault and our first corporate clients in institutional crypto-custody launching this summer.” said Josh Crumb, Founder and Chief Strategy Office.
    • Previously: Goldmoney reports FY results (June 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM | 2 Comments
  • TIS

    Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM (06/22/2018)

    • Gainers: TIS +10%. CLAR +8%. FNKO +6%. AOI +5%.
    • Losers: NAKD -20%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • MTCH

    Tinder launches Picks to take on Coffee Meets Bagel

    • Match Group’s (NASDAQ:MTCH) Tinder is testing a new feature to help people find matches that share interests in areas like education, hobbies, jobs, and more to take on competitor Coffee Meets Bagel.
    • The Tinder Picks feature will be available to those subscribed to Tinder Gold.
    • Tinder Picks will refresh every 24 hours but Gold users can opt to buy more access at any time.
    • Tinder Picks is now live in Brazil, Canada, France, Germany, Mexico, the Netherlands, Russia, Sweden, Turkey, and the United Kingdom.
    • Match Group shares are down 2.5% to $42.59. 
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 5 Comments
  • BTC-USD

    Bitcoin tumbles to lowest price this year

    • A regulatory crackdown in Japan is as good of an excuse as any for today's plunge in cryptos. Concerned with money laundering, Japan's Financial Services Agency has issued business-improvement orders against six of that country's largest crypto trading venues. At least one said it would stop accepting new customers and review the identifications of some existing clients.
    • Bitcoin (BTC-USD) -8.3% to $6,164. Ether (ETH-USD) -10.1%, Ripple (XRP-USD) -8%, Bitcoin Cash (BCH-USD) -12.6%, Litecoin (LTC-USD) -12.4%, EOS (EOS-USD) -18.5%.
    • Related tickers: OTCQX:GBTC, COIN, RIOT, OSTK, SSC-OLD, MARA, UEPS, OTC:BITCF, XNET, GROW, OTCPK:BTSC, OTCQB:BTCS, OTCQB:MGTI, OTCPK:BTLLF SRAX, OTCPK:GAHC, OTC:ARSC, OTCPK:USTC, OTCPK:BLKCF, COINB, BTC-USD, ETH-USD, XRP-USD, BCH-USD
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 110 Comments
  • BB

    BlackBerry -9% to two-month low after earnings

    • BlackBerry (NYSE:BB) has turned lower during the market session, down 9% to a two-month low, despite a headline beat in its earnings report mainly on the back of legacy business.
    • Revenues dropped 11%, but enterprise software and services took a tough fall, down 14% Y/Y and down 27% sequentially.
    • The company today also announced a new partnership to embed its security technology into a range of Caterpillar and Land Rover branded products. The deal with UK-based Bullitt Group will develop connected devices certified as "BlackBerry Secure."
    • "This new deal will allow us to expand our BlackBerry Secure footprint into the more than 100 markets that Bullitt Group currently distributes its products, especially in Europe, the Middle East and Africa,” says BlackBerry's Alex Thurber.
    • Related: BlackBerry: No Major Progress (Jun. 22 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM | 27 Comments
  • AMSWA

    American Software up 8% post Q4 results

    • American Software (AMSWA +8%) reports Q4 revenue growth of 11.8% Y/Y to $29.4M of which, License was $2.9M (-24% Y/Y); Services & other $15.5M (+30% Y/Y) & Maintenance $10.9M (+4% Y/Y).
    • Cloud Services Annual Contract Value increased ~108% Y/Y to $12.7M.
    • Gross margin increased 141 bps to 55.8% & Adj. EBITDA margin declined 400 bps to 15%.
    • Operating earnings were $2.5M (-16.7% Y/Y) & Adj. net earnings were $2M (-28.6% Y/Y).
    • The overall financial condition of the Company remains strong, with cash and investments of ~$87.8M with no debt.
    • During Q4 and fiscal 2018, the Company paid ~$3.4M and $13.3M in shareholder dividends, respectively.
    • Software license and SaaS subscription agreements were signed with customers located in the following 14 countries.
    • “We are pleased with our Q4 2018 results which reflect our investments in the innovative software and services needed to power the digital supply chain and help our customers reach new levels of productivity. Digitization drives a new wave of supply chain productivity which is more intelligent, responsive, scalable and collaborative,” said Allan Dow, President.
    • Previously: American Software misses by $0.01, beats on revenue (June 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • MU

    Axios: Chipmakers fighting back against Chinese investigations, IP theft

    • Axios reports on the recent Chinese government antitrust investigations into Micron (MU -2.8%), Samsung (OTC:SSNNF, OTC:SSNLF), and SK Hynix (OTC:HXSCF, OTC:HXSCL).
    • Chinese authorities claimed the investigations were tied to the rising prices in memory chips, which could put pressure on Chinese device makers operating with narrower margins. 
    • US companies and government officials have questioned whether China’s investigations have a different industrial drive. 
    • Key quote from a source familiar with the Micron investigation: ”They want access to the intellectual property. They need us to teach them how to do it. Once they have the industry, they want to push us out.” 
    • President Xi Jinping has said he wants China to become the global leader in cutting-edge tech like semiconductors by 2025. The government has put forward nearly $115B to achieve this goal. 
    • The Axios industry source says many industries have accepted Chinese IP theft but the difference with semiconductors “is we can still win because it’s really hard to do what we do.” 
    • A potential solution is to move semi manufacturing elsewhere like Malaysia where the IP is safer, but the supply chain has deep ties in China.  
    • Previously: Benchmark initiates Micron at 35% upside (June 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 125 Comments
  • CDNA

    CareDX cools off after monster run

    • CareDX (NASDAQ:CDNA) is down 19.0% as shares cool off after a monster 58% YTD run. Volume on CDNA today is almost triple normal trading activity.
    • Earlier this week, H.C. Wainwright downgraded the stock to Neutral from Buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM | 7 Comments
  • OSTK

    Selling pressure on Overstock.com

    • Overstock.com (NASDAQ:OSTK) is down 4.82% to extend on yesterday's post-SCOTUS ruling decline.
    • The company was one of the four online retailers that were part of South Dakota's original lawsuit that made it all the way up to the Supreme Court.
    • The selling pressure on Overstock.com could also be tied to another downward swing in crypto prices. Over the last 24 hours, Bitcoin is down 8% and Ethereum is off 10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM | 1 Comment
  • SLNO

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 AM (06/22/2018)

    • Gainers: SLNO +32%. AMPE +11%. INFI +10%. TNDM +10%. INNT +9%.
    • Losers: XBIO -17%. PTIE -16%. OBLN -15%. SBOT -10%. FCSC -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • KPAY

    KinerjaPay jumps after announcing entry into microlending in Indonesia

    • KinerjaPay (OTCQB:KPAY) +18% after announcing it's ready to start its own application for micro-lending in Indonesia.
    • Trading at $1.12 this morning, the shares are still less than half its 52-week high of $2.84, reached on Oct. 16.
    • Trading volume at 50,805 vs. three-month daily average 97,541.
    • KinerjaPay will mainly target the consumer sector to provide loans in the range of $100 to $1,000 on biweekly or monthly terms.
    • The company will get a 5% fee from the transactions, and estimates 1,00 transactions in the first few months of the launch.
    • Source: Press Release
    • Previously: KinerjaPay records sharp growth in gross revenue in March quarter (April 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • SLB

    Schlumberger rises, ION Geophysical falls on Supreme Court patent decision

    • The U.S. Supreme Court rules in favor of Schlumberger (SLB +3.9%) that companies can recover profits lost because of the unauthorized use of their patented technology abroad.
    • The decision overturns a lower court ruling that had enforced limits on applying U.S. patent law overseas and reduced by $93.4M the damages sum that rival ION Geophysical (IO -0.9%) had to pay for infringing SLB technology that helps find oil and gas beneath the ocean floor.
    • Internet-based companies also watched the case with interest on concerns that extending patent damages beyond national borders would expose U.S. high tech firms to greater patent-related risks abroad.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 8 Comments
  • BHC

    Valeant -2.8% as TD Securities cuts to Hold

    • Valeant (VRX) is down 2.8% after a downgrade at TD Securities to Hold, from Buy.
    • That comes after an 81% run over the past 12 months; shares are up 55% just for the past quarter.
    • HC Wainwright reiterated its Hold rating this week with a $20 price target; shares are currently at $24.03.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM | 93 Comments
  • PKE

    Park Electrochemical up 11% post Q1 results

    • Park Electrochemical (PKE +11.1%) reported Q1 net sales growth of 13.4% Y/Y to $31.1M and net earnings (before special items) of $3.37M (+35.8% Y/Y).
    • Sales by segment: Aerospace $10.4M (+19.8% Y/Y) and Electronics $20.7M (+10.7% Y/Y) of which 94% represents high performance ((non-FR-4) electronics materials sale.
    • Q1 Total sales by geography: Americas 53%, European 10% and Asian 37% compared to 56%, 7% and 37% year-over-year.
    • Q1 Gross margin improved by 430 bps to 27.4% and operating margin improved by 1,042 bps to 11.3%.
    • SG&A expenses were $4.81M (+2% Y/Y) and margin declined by 170 bps to 15.1%.
    • Previously: Park Electrochemical beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (June 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • PAGS

    PagSeguro announces pricing of its US$965M follow-on offering on the NYSE

    • PagSeguro Digital (PAGS +2.8%) prices follow-on public offering by it and its selling shareholder of 33M Class A common shares at a public offering price of $29.25.
    • The offering is expected to close on June 26, 2018, subject to customary closing conditions.
    • The company intends to use the net proceeds for ramping up investments in new technologies, products and services for its digital ecosystem. Any remaining net proceeds will be used for other general corporate purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • WUBA

    58.com buys minority stake in brokerage company, launches investment fund

    • 58.com (NYSE:WUBA) acquires a minority stake in rental brokerage company 5I5J Holding Group.
    • 58.com will pay RMB 1.068B in cash for an 8.28% stake.

  • TSM

    TSMC starts 7nm commercial production

    • TSMC (NYSE:TSM) has started commercial production of 7nm process technology chips and is scheduled to move a newer 5nm tech to mass production at the end of 2019 or early 2020, according to Digitimes.
    • The 7nm chip output will boost overall production capacity to 12M 12-inch equivalent wafers this year, up 9% Y/Y. 
    • Production growth for 7nm will come from Apple’s custom A12 processor for the upcoming iPhones and other customers including AMD, Nvidia, and Qualcomm. 
    • Sources say TSMC will carry out the majority of the orders in 1H19.   
    • TSMC shares are up 1.1% to $38.02.    
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM | 3 Comments

  • Crude oil prices jump in reaction to OPEC deal

    • Crude oil prices soar as OPEC reaches a deal to moderately increase production; WTI +3.3% at $67.69/bbl, Brent +2.7% at $75.07/bbl.
    • Although results are not yet official, the headline increase is 1M bbl/day but, due to supply constraints in some countries, only ~600K bbl/day is expected to be added to the market - roughly in-line with market expectations.
    • “Given the supply risks of Libya, Venezuela, and eventually Iran... the market sees this increment as something that’s not going to tilt it into bearish territory,” says Harry Tchilinguirian, global head of commodity markets strategy at BNP Paribas. “With OECD inventories now below their famous five-year average, prices will keep grinding higher.”
    • ETFs: USO, XLE, OIL, UWT, UCO, VDE, XOP, DWT, ERX, OIH, SCO, BNO, DBO, ERY, DIG, BGR, GUSH, DTO, FENY, USL, IYE, DUG, DRIP, IEO, FIF, DNO, NDP, PXE, OLO, RYE, PXJ, SZO, CRAK, FXN, OLEM, WTIU, DDG, OILK, NANR, OILX, WTID, USOI, USOU, USOD, FTXN, JHME, UBRT, ERYY, DBRT, ERGF, OILD, OILU, USAI

    UPS works out deal with Teamsters

    • UPS (NYSE:UPS) says it has a handshake deal with the negotiators for the Teamsters union.
    • The new contract provides hourly wage increases totaling $4.15 spread out over five years and raises the starting wage for part-time workers to $13 an hour as of August 1. The contract also carves out terms for so-called hybrid drivers that work on weekends.
    • The current contract expires on July 31.
    • Shares of UPS are up 1.17% in premarket trading to $114.75.
